column5: This course in Economics leads to the award of a Master in Science (Economics) (M.Sc. (Econ)). The objective of the course is to provide well-qualified graduates in economics and related disciplines with the training required to enter Ph.D. programmes in economics or to work as economists in government or private sector organisations. The course focuses on the technical skills needed to undertake economic research and emphasises active and problem-based learning to ensure mastery of the required skills.The course is available on a full-time or part-time basis. The full-time course takes approximately ten months, and begins with an intensive preliminary training in mathematics and statistics. Taken part-time, the course runs over two academic years.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
